moves.1. e4: Another game from freddy's tourney--This time I am done in by my Tactical Superior.  The preset moves continue essentially to 9th move.
moves.1... c5 2. f4 d5 3. Nf3 dxe4 4. Ng5 Nf6: I was hoping Black would move 11...Qh4  12. g3  Qxg4  13. Ne5, forking Black's K and Q.
moves.12. Ne5+ Kc7: Black is slowly moving the K to safety.
moves.13. O-O Rd8 14. a3: Done to keep Na6 from getting to c2.
moves.14... g6: White's goal is to keep Black from developing and applying pressure--I think it's safe to say White is failing in this endeavor.  I'm thinking this goes back to my dream of the K and Q fork back on move 11.  I probably should have just taken Rh8 at that point with the N.
moves.18. Be3: 18. Be3?  This leads to an exchange of Bishops--something White cannot afford.  I was too focused on my development.
White's pieces are developed but there's no real coordination.
moves.21... Rg8 22. c3 Rdd8 23. Reb1: It was here I decided I needed a plan (about time).  I wrote myself a note that I would break through Queenside or lose in the attempt.
moves.23... Nd5 24. Rf2 Nf6 25. Bf3: I can't exchange my other Bishop.  And if Black exchanges N's, my B would be aiming at b7.
moves.25... Nxe4 26. Bxe4 Qe8 27. b4: I was hoping for an exchange but Black was not open to that plan.
moves.27... c4 28. d4: This may have been an error but I was afraid to give Black an open file to exploit.
moves.29... Rg7 30. a4: My poor pawns on a4 and b5 go no further...where did I go wrong?
moves.30... Qg8 31. Rb4 g5 32. f5 exf5 33. Bf3: With 33 Bf3, I was thinking I could perhaps go to Be2 and then take c4, while disrupting Black's Kingside assault.
moves.35. hxg3 Rxg3: Looks like my Rook on f2 isn't going anywhere for awhile.  I've completely lost the initiative now and I'm just reacting.
moves.36. Bxc4 Qg5 37. Nf7 Qc1+ 38. Rf1 Qxc3 3: At this point, I thought I had Black's R on f3 for my B.  I was feeling pretty good--I failed to notice by poor N all alone on f7  :tears:
moves.39... Qxc4 40. Rxg3 Qxf7: A B+N+P for a R--not a good exchange for White--Superior Tactics wins the day.
moves.41. Rgf3 Qc4 42. Rd1: I knew one pawn would drop--I decided to save d4.
moves.42... Qxa4 43. Rxf5:
43...Qxd1+??

I believe the word for this is "blunder."
moves.43... Qxd1+: I believe the phrase that applies here is "ruinous loss of material."  Congrats to Joanne as she played well and showed me quite clearly that I will not progress until I become a stronger tactician.  Any and all criticism is welcome.

gameName: The Annotation Project - To The Tactician, Goes The Spoils
